intro: Salt - chemical compound NaCl - was pretty important stuff in the Bible. Tell us what you know about salt, both literal and figurative.

questions.ask: Whose wife was turned into a pillar of salt for looking back on the doomed cities of Sodom and Gomorrah?
What did Jesus tell His disciples they were "the salt of"?
What did the apostle Paul say should be "seasoned with salt"?
What did Mark quote Jesus as saying everyone would be "salted with"?
What Old Testament prophet healed the waters of Jericho by throwing salt into a spring?

intro: Simon was a popular name in Bible times. Here are five men who were known by the name Simon - your job is to more clearly identify each one

questions.ask: What did a Simon from Cyrene carry for Jesus as He walked to His execution?
What famous half-brother could a certain Simon, with his full brothers James, Joseph, and Judas, claim?
What two-word nickname - from a dreaded disease he had - described a Simon from Bethany?
What forbidden art did a Simon from Samaria practice before he accepted Christ?
What job was held by a Simon from Joppa, who entertained the apostle Peter in his house by the sea?

intro: Two hints on this quiz: Every answer begins with the letter S, and each answer is the name of a biblical man

questions.ask: What man is generally listed first in the accounts of Noah's sons?
What man, described in Acts as "full of faith and of the Holy Spirit," was one of seven chosen to relieve the apostles of waiting on tables?
What devout man held the baby Jesus when Mary and Joseph presented Him at the temple?
What king of Assyria insulted God to King Hezekiah of Judah - and paid for it with his life?
What man, a Horonite, opposed Nehemiah and the Jews rebuilding the walls of Jerusalem?

intro: Call it "evangelism", "preaching the gospel", or "bringing in the sheaves." Christians have an obligation to win souls. What do you recall about the Bible's soulwinning passages?

questions.ask: What two disciples from Jesus' inner circle, described as "unschooled, ordinary men," amazed the Jewish leaders with their courage in preaching the gospel
What agricultural term did Jesus use to describe the soul-winners' goal?
What businesswoman from Thyatiram, a seller of purple cloth, became a Christian after hearing Paul share the gospel?
What word did Solomon, in the Proverbs, use to describe soul winners?
What five-word phrase did the apostle Paul say he had become in his efforts to bring various people to Christ?
